sen.j: 山城屋事件は1872年（明治5年）陸軍省の御用商人山城屋和助が陸軍省から無担保で借り受けた公金を返済できず自殺した事件。
sen.e: The Yamashiroya Incident is an incident that a government contractor of the Ministry of Army Wasuke YAMASHIROYA committed suicide when he was unable to repay the public money he borrowed from the Ministry without putting up collateral in 1872.

The Yamashiroya Incident was an incident that Wasuke YAMASHIROYA, a government contractor for the Ministry of Army, committed suicide when he was unable to repay the public money he had borrowed from the Ministry without putting up collateral in 1872.
sen.cmt: is→wasにしました。Wasuke YAMASHIROYAを肩書き(a government contractor･･･）の前にしました。Contractorの後のofをforにしました。Borrowed→had borrowedにしました。
sen.e: The Yamashiroya Incident was an incident that Wasuke YAMASHIROYA, a government contractor for the Ministry of Army, committed suicide when he was unable to repay the public money he had borrowed from the Ministry without collateral in 1872.
sen.cmt: putting up を削除しました。

sen.j: 山城屋の借り出した公金は総額約65万円、当時の国家歳入の1%という途方もない額であった（藤村道生『山縣有朋』53ページによれば「歳入の12%」）。
sen.e: The public money YAMASHIROYA borrowed was 650,000 yen in total, which was an enormous amount of money equivalent to 1% of the annual national revenue at that time (according to the page 53 of "Aritomo Yamagata" written by Michio FUJIMURA, it was 12% of the national revenue).
sen.cmt: ・原文の「あった」と「藤村」の間に全く区切りがなかったため、「藤村」以降の文をカッコで閉じました。 ・本のタイトルである『山縣有朋』の「山縣」は小文字も含めて記述しました。
sen.e: The public money YAMASHIROYA had borrowed was approximately 650,000 yen in total, which was an enormous amount of money as much as 1% of the annual national revenue at that time (according to the page 53 of "Aritomo Yamagata" written by Michio FUJIMURA, it was 12% of the national revenue).
sen.cmt: Borrowed→had borrowedにしました。650,000yenの前にApproximatelyを入れました。「1%という」は必ずしも「1%に等しい」わけではないと思われましたので、equivalent toをas much asとしました。
sen.e: The public money YAMASHIROYA had borrowed was approximately 650,000 yen in total, which was an enormous amount of money as much as 1% of the annual national revenue at that time (according to the page 53 of "Aritomo Yamagata" written by Michio FUJIMURA, it was 12% of the national revenue).

sen.j: 山城屋和助は長州人という縁故で兵部省御用商人となった。
sen.e: Wasuke YAMASHIROYA became a government contractor of Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) taking advantage of his personal connection with people from Choshu, where he was also from.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Wasuke YAMASHIROYA became a government contractor of Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) because he came from Choshu.
sen.cmt: 「taking advantage･･･」→「because he came from」にしました。
sen.e: Wasuke YAMASHIROYA became a government contractor of Hyobusho (Ministry of Military) because he came from Choshu.

sen.j: 軍需品の納入などにたずさわっていたが、陸軍省の公金15万ドルを借用して生糸相場に手をだした。
sen.e: He was engaged in delivery of military supplies but he borrowed 150,000 dollars of public money from the Ministry of Army and started to invest in silk market.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While he was engaged in delivery of military supplies, he borrowed 150,000 dollars of public money from the Ministry of Army and started to invest in silk market.
sen.cmt: この場合の「が」は逆接の意味はないと思われましたので、whileにして冒頭に入れました。
sen.e: While he was engaged in overseeing the delivery of military supplies, he borrowed 150,000 dollars of public money from the Ministry of the Army and started to invest in the silk market.

sen.j: この借金の背景には、陸軍省保管の現銀が価格低落を被っていたことがある。
sen.e: Behind the background of this borrowings, there was a fact that the price of silver coins kept by the Ministry of Army declined.
The background of this borrowings was the declined price of silver coins kept by the Ministry of Army.
sen.cmt: Behindを取って、The backgroundを主語にしました。
sen.e: The background of this borrowings was the declined price of silver coins kept by the Ministry of Army.

sen.j: 陸軍省は資金運用を理由として公金貸し付けを行った。
sen.e: The Ministry of Army lent the public money to him on grounds of fund management.
The Ministry of Army lent the public money to him on grounds of fund management.
The Ministry of Army lent the public money to him on grounds of fund management.

sen.j: ところが、ヨーロッパでの生糸相場の暴落にあって投機は失敗。
sen.e: However, his investment failed since the market price of silk in Europe plunged.
However, his investment ended in failure since the market price of silk in Europe plunged.
However, his investment ended in failure since the market price of silk in Europe plunged.

sen.j: 山城屋は陸軍省から更に金を借り出し、フランスの商人と直接取引をしようとフランスに渡った。
sen.e: He borrowed more money from the Ministry of Army and went to France to deal directly with French merchants.
sen.cmt: 話の続きなので、「YAMASHIROYA」ではなく「he」にしました。
sen.e: He borrowed more money from the Ministry of Army and went to France to deal directly with French merchants.
He borrowed more money from the Ministry of Army and went to France to deal directly with French merchants.

sen.j: そのうちに一人の日本人がフランスで豪遊しているという情報が、フランス駐在中弁務使鮫島尚信やイギリス駐在大弁務使寺島宗則の耳に入り、日本の外務省・副島外務卿に連絡が入った。
sen.e: In the meantime, a France-based middle commissioner Naonobu SAMEJIMA and an England-based major commissioner Munenori TERASHIMA heard the information that one Japanese was engaging in extravagances and reported to the Foreign Minister SOEJIMA in Japan.
sen.cmt: 重複を避けるため、「外務省」はあえて入れませんでした。
sen.e: In the meantime, a France-based middle commissioner Naonobu SAMEJIMA and an England-based major commissioner Munenori TERASHIMA heard a news that one Japanese was engaging in extravagances and this news was reported to the Foreign Minister SOEJIMA in Japan.
sen.cmt: the information→a newsにしました。「and reported」の間に「this news was」を入れました。
sen.e: In the meantime, a France-based middle commissioner Naonobu SAMEJIMA and an England-based major commissioner Munenori TERASHIMA heard a news that one Japanese was engaging in extravagances and this news was reported to the Foreign Minister SOEJIMA in Japan.

sen.j: このころ、山縣有朋は近衛都督として近衛兵を統括する立場にあったが、近衛兵内部の薩摩系軍人には長州人である山縣を近衛都督としていただくことを不服とする空気が強かった。
sen.e: At this time, Aritomo YAMAGATA was supervising imperial guards as the commander, but there was a strong dissatisfaction among those guards from Satsuma against YAMAGATA since he was from Choshu.

At this time, while Aritomo YAMAGATA was on the position of supervising imperial guards as the commander, there was a strong dissatisfaction among those guards from Satsuma against YAMAGATA, who was from Choshu.
sen.cmt: 「立場にあった」ので「on the position of」を挿入しました。「あったが」の「が」は逆接ではないと思われますので、but→whileにしArimotoの前に入れました。「since he was」を「, who was」にしました。
sen.e: At this time, while Aritomo YAMAGATA was on the position of supervising imperial guards as the commander, there was a strong dissatisfaction among those guards from Satsuma against YAMAGATA, who was from Choshu.

sen.j: そこに山城屋の一件を聞いた陸軍省会計監督・種田政明が密かに調査を始めた。
sen.e: Moreover, the accounting manager of Ministry of Army Masaaki TANEDA heard the information of YAMASHIROYA and started investigation secretly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, Masaaki TANEDA, the accounting manager of Ministry of Army, heard the news on YAMASHIROYA and started investigation secretly.
sen.cmt: Masaaki TANEDAの肩書きを名前の後にしました。Information of→news onにしました。
sen.e: Moreover, Masaaki TANEDA, the accounting manager of Ministry of Army, heard the news on YAMASHIROYA and started investigation secretly.

sen.j: 「一品の抵当もなしに」多額の陸軍省公金が貸し付けられていたことが発覚、桐野利秋ら薩摩藩系陸軍人の激しく追及するところとなる。
sen.e: The fact that an enormous amount of public money was lent by the Ministry of Army was revealed and the military men from Satsuma including Toshiaki KIRINO grilled about it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The fact that an enormous amount of public money was lent by the Ministry of Army was revealed and the military men from Satsuma including Toshiaki KIRINO investigated it thoroughly.
sen.cmt: 「一品の抵当もなしに」に対する訳がありません。grilled about it→investigated it thoroughlyにしました。
sen.e: When the truth came out that such an enormous sum of public money had been lent, 'without any objection', by the Ministry of the Army, several army officers from Satsuma, including Toshiaki KIRINO, launched an investigation thoroughly.

sen.j: 同年7月山縣は陸軍中将・近衛都督を辞任。
sen.e: In July 1871, YAMAGATA resigned as a lieutenant general and the commander of imperial guards.
sen.cmt: 「同年」とありますが、それ以前の文に関連する年号の記載がないため、いったい何年なのかわかりません。次の文が「翌1872年」で始まるので、一応1871年としておきましたが、調べてみるとこの年号の正確性は不明です。
sen.e: In July 1871, YAMAGATA resigned as a lieutenant general and the commander of imperial guards.
In July 1871, YAMAGATA resigned as a lieutenant general and the commander of imperial guards.

sen.j: 翌1872年（明治5年）、江藤新平率いる司法省による本格的な調査が始まろうとした同年11月、山城屋は山縣から至急の返済を求められた。
sen.e: In November 1872, when the Ministry of Justice led by Shinpei ETO was about to start a serious investigation, YAMAGATA asked YAMASHIROYA to repay the money he owed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 「同年11月」の後に、「山城屋は」を付け加えました。
sen.e: In November 1872, when the Ministry of Justice led by Shinpei ETO was about to start a serious investigation, YAMAGATA asked YAMASHIROYA to repay the money he had borrowed.
In November 1872, when the Ministry of Justice led by Shinpei ETO was about to start a serious investigation, YAMAGATA asked YAMASHIROYA to repay the money he had borrowed.

sen.j: 山城屋は公金返済が不可能であったため、陸軍省内部で割腹自殺。
sen.e: Since YAMASHIROYA was unable to repay the public money, he committed suicide through disembowelment inside the Ministry of Army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since YAMASHIROYA was unable to repay the public money, he committed suicide through disembowelment inside the building of the Ministry of Army.
sen.cmt: 「陸軍省内部」というのは建物の中であることを言いたいと思われましたので、buildingを加えました。
sen.e: Since YAMASHIROYA was unable to repay the public money, he committed suicide through disembowelment inside the building of the Ministry of Army.

sen.j: その際、関係する帳簿と長州系軍人の借金証文類も焼き払われた為、事件の真相は解明されることなく、陸軍省会計監督長船越衛の処分をもって収束する。
sen.e: Because all the relevant account books and debt bonds issued by military men from Choshu were burned away then, the truth of the incident was not clarified and the investigation ended with punishment of the accounting manager of the Ministry of Army Mamoru FUNAKOSHI.

Because all the relevant account books and debt bonds issued by military men from Choshu were burned away then, the truth of the incident was not clarified and the investigation ended with punishment of the accounting manager of the Ministry of Army Mamoru FUNAKOSHI.

Because all the relevant account books and debt bonds issued by military men from Choshu were burned away then, the truth of the incident was not clarified and the investigation ended with punishment of the accounting manager of the Ministry of Army Mamoru FUNAKOSHI.

sen.j: 一説にはこう言われている。
sen.e: One theory is as follows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「一説には」がかかっている文章が非常に長かったので、わかりやすくするため分割しました。
sen.e: One theory goes as follows.
One theory goes as follows.

sen.j: 徴兵令を推進する山縣とこれに反発する桐野を代表する薩摩系を中心とした保守的な軍人の対立があった。
sen.e: There was a conflict between YAMAGATA who was promoting Conscription Ordinance and KIRINO who represented conservative military men mainly from Satsuma and was opposing YAMAGATA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was a conflict between YAMAGATA who was promoting Conscription Ordinance and opposing military men from Satsuma represented by KIRINO.
sen.cmt: 「対立」は山縣対桐野になっていますが、桐野に対する修飾が長すぎるので、山縣対軍人として後半部分を書き直しました。
sen.e: There was a conflict between YAMAGATA who was promoting Conscription Ordinance and opposing military men from Satsuma represented by KIRINO.

sen.j: しかも後者が山縣の抑制に期待をかけた西郷隆盛は、却って山縣を評価して弟の西郷従道とともに徴兵令の実施を支援した。
sen.e: In addition, even though KIRINO was hoping Takamori SAIGO would play a major role to restrain YAMAGATA, SAIGO appreciated YAMAGATA on the contrary and supported him to enact Conscription Ordinance with his younger brother Tsugumichi SAIGO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, KIRINO relied on Takamori SAIGO to play a major role in restraining YAMAGATA, but on the contrary SAIGO appreciated YAMAGATA and, together with his younger brother Tsugumichi SAIGO, supported him to enact Conscription Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 「was hoping･･･would」を「relied on･･･to」にし、その直後のtoをin ～ingにしました。「on the contrary」を「but on the contrary」にして文の継ぎ目に入れ、「even though」を取りました。「with･･･」を「together with」にして、動作「supported」の前に入れました。
sen.e: In addition, KIRINO relied on Takamori SAIGO to play a major role in restraining YAMAGATA, but on the contrary SAIGO appreciated YAMAGATA and, together with his younger brother Tsugumichi SAIGO, supported him to enact Conscription Ordinance.

sen.j: そのことに対する（桐野の）山縣への嫉妬と敵意がこの事件の追及を強めた原因とされる。
sen.e: This is ascribed as the cause that KIRINO intensified criticism against YAMAGATA pursuing the investigation of the case out of jealousy and hostility.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。主語がわかりにくいので、カッコ書きで（桐野の）と原文に加えました。
sen.e: KIRINO's jealousy and hostility against YAMAGATA was ascribed to the intensified pursuit of this incident.
sen.cmt: 訳文と原文の対応が難解であり、pursuingがどのように繋がってくるのかが分からなかったので、なるべく訳文の言葉を用いて書き直しました。
sen.e: KIRINO's jealousy and hostility against YAMAGATA was ascribed to the intensified pursuit of this incident.

sen.j: 事実、西郷は最後まで山縣の辞任には反対していた。
sen.e: As a matter of fact, SAIGO was opposing YAMAGATA's resignation until the last moment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a matter of fact, SAIGO remained opposing YAMAGATA's resignation until the last moment.
As a matter of fact, SAIGO remained opposing YAMAGATA's resignation until the last moment.

sen.j: さらに、辞任後岩倉使節団の一員として洋行中の大久保利通に対して山縣を擁護出来なかったことを詫びる手紙を送っている（1872年8月12日付大久保宛西郷書簡）。
sen.e: Moreover, SAIGO sent a letter to Toshimichi OKUBO who was traveling as a member of Iwakura Mission to apologize that he could not protect YAMAGATA after he resigned (according to the letter from SAIGO to OKUBO written on August 12, 1872).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, SAIGO sent a letter to Toshimichi OKUBO who was traveling abroad as a member of Iwakura Mission to apologize that he could not protect YAMAGATA after his resignation (according to the letter from SAIGO to OKUBO written on August 12, 1872).
sen.cmt: 「洋行」なのでabroadを入れました。「after he resigned」→「after his resignation」としました。
sen.e: Moreover, SAIGO sent a letter to Toshimichi OKUBO who was traveling abroad as a member of Iwakura Mission to apologize that he could not protect YAMAGATA after his resignation (according to the letter from SAIGO to OKUBO written on August 12, 1872).

sen.j: また、司法省の権限強化を目指した江藤新平の追及もこの事件に大きな影響を与えている。
sen.e: In addition, the pursuit by Shinpei ETO who aimed strengthening of authority for the Ministry of Justice affected this incident greatly as well.
In addition, the pursuit by Shinpei ETO who aimed strengthening of authority for the Ministry of Justice also had a great influence on this incident.
sen.cmt: 「追求も」なので、alsoをhadの前に入れ、as wellを取りました。Affected greatly→had a great influence onにしました。
sen.e: In addition, the pursuit by Shinpei ETO who aimed strengthening of authority for the Ministry of Justice also had a great influence on this incident.

sen.j: 江藤は、薩摩系軍人が山城屋の事務所封鎖を計画しているのを知ってこれを抑え、司法省が直接捜査に乗り出すよう指示を出している。
sen.e: Finding out that military men from Satsuma was planning to close the office of YAMASHIROYA, ETO prevented them and ordered the Ministry of Justice to start an investigation directly.
Eto, finding out that military men from Satsuma had been planning to close the office of YAMASHIROYA, prevented them and ordered the Ministry of Justice to start an investigation directly.
sen.cmt: Etoを冒頭に移動し、主語を明確にしました。Was planningをhad been planningにしました。
sen.e: Eto, finding out that military men from Satsuma had been planning to close the office of YAMASHIROYA, prevented them and ordered the Ministry of Justice to start an investigation directly.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）6月、山縣渡欧。
sen.e: In June 1869, YAMAGATA went to Europe.
In June 1869, YAMAGATA went to Europe.
In June 1869, YAMAGATA went to Europe.

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年）8月、山縣帰国。

In August 1870, YAMAGATA returned home.
In August 1870, YAMAGATA returned home.

sen.j: 従五位兵部少輔となる。
sen.e: He became Hyobu shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Ministry of Military), which was Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
He became Hyobu shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Ministry of Military), which was Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
